smcDosWsPcTyp.name: smcDosWsPcTyp
smcDosWsPcTyp.description: Make and model of the PC. This may have to be entered in the configuration disk file. It may or may not be detectable via signature strings in the BIOS.

smcDosWsPcProc.name: smcDosWsPcProc
smcDosWsPcProc.description: This is a text string showing the processor type and indicating whether a math coprocessor exists, e.g. '80286 w/math coprocessor'.

smcDosWsPcBios.name: smcDosWsPcBios
smcDosWsPcBios.description: This is a text signature string identifying the PC bios, e.g. 'Phoenix 80386SX ROM BIOS PLUS Version 1.10'.

smcDosWsPcRam.name: smcDosWsPcRam
smcDosWsPcRam.description: This is a text string listing the PC's ram configuration, base, EMS, XMS, e.g. '640K base, 1024K EMS, 3072K XMS'.

smcDosWsPcDisk.name: smcDosWsPcDisk
smcDosWsPcDisk.description: This is a text string listing the PC's disk configuration, number and size of drives, e.g. '1.25M Fpy, 1.44M Fpy, 79M HD'.

smcDosWsPcVideo.name: smcDosWsPcVideo
smcDosWsPcVideo.description: This is a text string listing the PC's video interface type and monitor type, e.g. 'VGA Color'.

smcDosWsPcIo.name: smcDosWsPcIo
smcDosWsPcIo.description: This is a text string listing the parallel and serial ports installed on the PC, e.g. 'LPT1, COM1, COM2'.

smcDosWsDosVer.name: smcDosWsDosVer
smcDosWsDosVer.description: This is a text string listing the version of DOS, e.g. 'DOS 3.3'.

smcDosWsDrvId.name: smcDosWsDrvId
smcDosWsDrvId.description: This is the signature string from the network driver. It is similar to the string that is displayed by the NetWare server MONITOR nlm.

smcDosWsNicBasIo.name: smcDosWsNicBasIo
smcDosWsNicBasIo.description: This is the I/O base address of the adapter card.

smcDosWsNicIrq.name: smcDosWsNicIrq
smcDosWsNicIrq.description: This is the adapter IRQ number.

smcDosWsNicRam.name: smcDosWsNicRam
smcDosWsNicRam.description: This is the adapter card packet ram address.

smcDosWsNodId.name: smcDosWsNodId
smcDosWsNodId.description: This is the adapter card 48 bit node ID.

smcDosWsIpAdr.name: smcDosWsIpAdr
smcDosWsIpAdr.description: This is the IP address of the PC. The agent takes this information from a configuration disk file. If the PC is also running a TCP/IP stack, it is up to the installer to specify in the agent configuration file the same IP address that the PC's TCP/IP stack has.

smcDosWsComment.name: smcDosWsComment
smcDosWsComment.description: This is a text string which is set from a configuration disk file that contains comments about the PC that the network manager feels is meaningful. For example 'Motherboard replaced 3 times in the last year'.

smcDosWsPcDate.name: smcDosWsPcDate
smcDosWsPcDate.description: This shows the current date set into the PC to alert the network manager of potential problems with software that decides configuration currency based on file dates and times.

smcDosWsPcTime.name: smcDosWsPcTime
smcDosWsPcTime.description: This shows the current time set into the PC to alert the network manager of potential problems with software that decides configuration currency based on file dates and times. Note that because of polling times this time may be erratic within a window of a few seconds.

smcDosWsRst.name: smcDosWsRst
smcDosWsRst.description: This variable always reports value = 1. Setting it to 2 results in an adapter reset, after which it will contain value = 1 again.

smcDosWsProtoMix.name: smcDosWsProtoMix
smcDosWsProtoMix.description: This text string reports the most frequent transport protocols and their approximate percentages of traffic load.

smcDosWsRcvPkts.name: smcDosWsRcvPkts
smcDosWsRcvPkts.description: Number of packets received by the workstation

smcDosWsXmtPkts.name: smcDosWsXmtPkts
smcDosWsXmtPkts.description: Number of packets sent by the workstation

smcDosWsDrvSpcId.name: smcDosWsDrvSpcId
smcDosWsDrvSpcId.description: Number of Driver Specific entry. 1 for first entry, 2 for second entry, etc.

smcDosWsDrvSpcTxt.name: smcDosWsDrvSpcTxt
smcDosWsDrvSpcTxt.description: Textual name of driver specific diagnostic counter

smcDosWsDrvSpcCnt.name: smcDosWsDrvSpcCnt
smcDosWsDrvSpcCnt.description: Numeric value of driver specific diagnostic counter

smcDosWsTrapId.name: smcDosWsTrapId
smcDosWsTrapId.description: Number of Trap Destination entry. 1 for first entry, 2 for second entry, etc.

smcDosWsTrapDstAdr.name: smcDosWsTrapDstAdr
smcDosWsTrapDstAdr.description: This is an IP address to which alerts (traps) should be sent when significant events occur.

smcDosWsTrapDstPro.name: smcDosWsTrapDstPro
smcDosWsTrapDstPro.description: This is a code indicating the protocol to use when sending alerts. 1 means disabled, i.e. the corresponding smcDosWsTrapDstAdr variable is not really intended to receive traps. 2 means use TCP/IP protocol. 3,4,5,6 mean use IPX protocol using Ethernet II, RAW 802.2, 802.2 SNAP or 802.3 physical layer.

smcDosWsApiTrap.name: smcDosWsApiTrap
smcDosWsApiTrap.description: This is a string set by external applications which use the PC Agent API to send an SNMP trap
